isis.stitle: Body Builder Electrical Data Book for Models Built January 2001 to February 28, 2007 - Electrical Features - Remote Throttle - 60AJG - Remote Throttle Control Programmable Mode for Various Switch Actions

svcproc.title: 60AJG - Remote Throttle Control Programmable Mode for Various Switch Actions
svcproc.para: FEATURE CODE DESCRIPTION: BDY INTG, THROTTLE CONTROL Accommodation for Single Customer Mounted External Engine Speed Control Switch, for Utility Applications, Programmable Mode for Various Switch Actions and Engine Speed Control Option, Only with Vehicle Stopped and Park Brake is Applied (requires 1 Remote Power Module input)

FEATURE/BODY FUNCTION: This feature provides the operator of Utility applications with external control of the engine speed with a customer-mounted switch. Activation of a customer-installed switch increases the engine speed to the first preset value. This feature utilizes one pin on the Black 23-pin Remote Power Module input connector (Use ICAP or the Diamond Logic™ Builder software to determine correct pin location). The ESC reads the voltage on this input pin and communicates the correct action to the Engine Control Module. Use customer supplied single pull, double throw, center stable, momentary switch. This code is offered to add additional functionality and to provide a simpler alternative to the hardwired Remote Engine Speed Controls offered by 12VVW or 12VYC. All remote throttle switches and associated wiring should be customer supplied. Feature code 12VXU is required to program the engine for the desired mode of engine speed control. This option is only useable when Vehicle Speed is 0 Mph and Park Brake is applied.
60AJG Default Switch Action: Applying momentary ground to the Remote Power Module ramps engine to first preset speed. Applying momentary ground a second time returns engine to idle.
Software feature codes that must be removed: 595241, 595172, 595196, 595263

entry.para: This parameter sets the mode of operation for the TEM External Engine Speed Control feature.
This is the active state for the external engine speed control switch.

svcproc.para: The engine speed control will only operate when the vehicle is stopped with the park brake applied and the transmission in neutral. The increased engine speed will be cancelled if any of these conditions are not met or if:

item.para: The cruise disable switch is depressed

svcproc.para: This parameter controls the mode in which the engine speed control feature operates. The setting of this parameter depends upon the type of switch that will be controlling the engine speed and the speed control action that is desired. The mode is described in terms of what the engine will do based on what state is on the Remote Power Module Input. The valid states on an RPM input are:

item.para: Ground - The input is connected to ground through a switch
Floating - The input is not connected to anything
12 Volts - The input is connected to 12 Volts through a switch

entry.para: In this mode, the feature will be expecting a momentary (not latched) type switch. When the switch is depressed and released, the engine will ramp to engine preset 1. When the switch is depressed and released again, the engine will return to idle. There are two different connection diagrams shown for the two possible active states of the input. The selecting of the active state is done with the active state parameter explained below.

svcproc.para: This parameter can only be used on vehicles that have an International PTO feature.

If this parameter is set, the remote engine speed control will be interlocked to PTO. This means that the remote engine speed control will only be allowed to operate if the PTO is being requested to engage. If this parameter is not set, the engine speed control will operate regardless of the PTO request.

entry.para: Floating (the plunger provides a floating input to the remote power module when depressed. This setting is not recommended)
Ground (the plunger provides a ground to the remote power module input when depressed)
12 Volts (the plunger provides 12 Volts to the remote power module input when depressed)

item.para: Customer provides a ground active momentary switch that is wired into the pin labeled Remote_Engine_Speed_Sw_Input on the Black 23-pin input connector on the Remote Power Module (See ICAP or the Diamond Logic™ Builder software for correct pin location).

step1.para: Activate the Remote Engine Speed Control Switch (Close switch to active input condition that has been programmed; i.e., 12 volts or Ground).
Verify the Remote Power Module Input labeled Remote_Engine_Speed_Sw_Input (Pin position specified by ICAP or the Diamond Logic™ Builder software is receiving Ground as long as the switch is closed).
Verify that the engine ramps to the first preset speed.
If engine does not ramp to the first preset speed, check engine programming to verify that the correct engine speed control parameters are set.
Deactivate the Remote Engine Speed Control switch (Release Ground).
Verify the Remote Power Module Input labeled Remote_Engine_Speed_Sw_Input (Pin position specified by ICAP or the Diamond Logic™ Builder software) is an open circuit.
Verify that the engine returns to idle.

item.para: Select software feature code 595240 using ICAP or the Diamond Logic™ Builder software (See Local Dealer)
Using ICAP or the Diamond Logic™ Builder software, make sure that software feature codes 595241, 595172, 595196, and 595263 are removed from the vehicle (See Local Dealer)
Use ICAP or the Diamond Logic™ Builder software to determine which pin on the Black 23-pin Remote Power Module input connector has been assigned to Remote Engine Speed Control
Customer must install a remote-mounted switch to control Engine Speed and a wire that runs from the switch to the pin labeled Remote_Engine_Speed_Sw_Input on the Remote Power Module input connector.
